* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to

public Parser(Ui ui, TaskList taskList, String input) {
* Scans the user inputs and calls necessary methods based on the command input by the user.
* Represents the file where the tasks input by the user are store at.
* @param filePath Path of the file to store the output.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file to store the output is not found.
* Reads the file and adds each task to the taskList.

throw new DukeException("Unable to read task in file");
* Reads the file and adds each task to the taskList.
* @param tasks A list which stores the tasks.
* @throws IOException If the file is unavailable for writing.
public void writeStorage(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Represents a task which an user input in the Duke chatbox.
* instr (instructions), which describes the task required to be carried out and
* done, which describes the status of the task (whether it is completed).
* Changes the Task's status to done when the task is completed.
* Getter for instr (instruction), the description of the task.
* Indicates if the task is completed. Returns true when task is done.
* Represents the list which stores the tasks input by the user.
* Delete a task from the list based on the index input by the user.
* @param index Index of a task in the list.
* @throws DukeException If the index input is unavailable in the list of tasks.
* Changes the indicated task's status to done.
* @param index Index of a task in the list.
* @throws DukeException If the index input is unavailable in the list of tasks.
* Adds a new to-do into the tasks list.
* @throws DukeException If the description of the to-do is empty.
* Adds a new deadline into the tasks list.
* @throws DukeException If the description of the deadline is empty.
* Adds a new event into the tasks list.
* @throws DukeException If the description of the event is empty.
* Returns a list of tasks that contains the keyword.
* Represents the user interface. Ui outputs messages and interacts with the user.
* Bids farewell after the user input "bye".
return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* Prints the list of tasks in the order of input.
* @param taskList A list which stores the tasks input by the user.
return "Here are the tasks in your list: \n" + taskList;
* Prints the list of search results.
return "Here are the matching tasks in your list: \n" + taskList;
* Prints a message to notify the user that a task is deleted.
* @param totalTask Total number of tasks in the tasks list.
public String delete(Task delTask, int totalTask) {
return "Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + delTask
+ "\nNow you have " + totalTask + " tasks in the list.";
* Prints a message to notify the user that a task is completed.
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + doneTask;
* Prints a message to notify the user that a new task has been added to the list.
* @param totalTask Total number of tasks in the tasks list.
public String addTask(Task newTask, int totalTask) {
return "Got it. I've added this task: \n" + newTask
+ "\nNow you have " + totalTask + " tasks in the list.";
* Prints a message to warn the user when the system is unable to recognise the command.
return "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(";
* Prints a message to warn the user when the index input for a delete or done
* Prints a message to warn the user when the description for a task is empty.
return "OOPS!!! The description of a task cannot be empty.";
